quiz.question: What is a process in the context of operating systems?
options: A single task that is executed by the CPU
A collection of threads that share resources
A binary executable file stored on disk
A hardware component that manages memory
quiz.hint: It involves multiple threads and resource sharing.

quiz.question: Which of the following is true about threads?
options: Threads run in separate memory spaces
Threads share the same data and code segments
Threads execute independently of processes
Threads cannot share resources
quiz.hint: Threads are part of a process and share certain segments.

quiz.question: What is the main goal of CPU scheduling?
options: To maximize CPU idle time
To ensure all processes have equal priority
To improve system efficiency and response time
To allocate more CPU time to I/O-bound processes
quiz.hint: Think about system performance and efficiency.

quiz.question: Which technique allows for the execution of processes that require more memory than what is physically available?
options: Swapping
Virtual Memory
Fragmentation
Paging
quiz.hint: This technique uses a combination of RAM and disk space.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of a file system in an operating system?
options: To manage the execution of processes
To provide a way to store and organize files
To control access to the CPU
To handle network communications
quiz.hint: Think about data storage and organization.
